englishTranslationText:
“And	make	me	among	the	inheritors	of	the	
Gardens	of	serenity.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	mujhe	un	meiñ	kar	jo	chain	ke	bāghoñ	ke	
wāris	haiñ

arabicText: وَٱغْفِرْ لِأَبِىٓ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	forgive	my	father	*	–	he	is	indeed	
astray.”	(His	paternal	uncle)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	mere	bāp	ko	bakhsh	de	be-shak	woh		
gumrāh	hai

englishTranslationText:
“And	do	not	disgrace	me	on	the	day	when	
everyone	will	be	raised.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	mujhe	ruswā	na	karnā	jis	din	sab	uthāye	
jāyeiñ	ge

arabicText: يَوْمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٌۭ وَلَا بَنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“The	day	when	neither	wealth	will	benefit	
nor	will	sons.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	din	na	māl	kām	āayegā	na	bete

arabicText: إِلَّا مَنْ أَتَى ٱللَّهَ بِقَلْبٍۢ سَلِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Except	he	who	presented	himself	before	
Allah,	with	a	sound*	heart.”	(Intact	or	
unblemished.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Magar	woh	jo	Allah	ke	huzoor	hāzir	howa	
salāmat	dil	lekar

englishTranslationText:
And	Paradise	will	be	brought	close	for	the	
pious.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	qareeb	lāyi	jāyegi	Jannat	parhezgāroñ	ke	
liye

englishTranslationText: And	hell	will	be	revealed	for	the	astray.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	zāhir	ki	jāyegi	dozakh	gumrāhoñ	ke	liye.

arabicText: وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	it	will	be	said	to	them,	“Where	are	those	
whom	you	used	to	worship?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	unse	kahā	jāyegā:	kahāñ	haiñ	woh		jinko	
tum	poojte	they?

arabicText: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ هَلْ يَنصُرُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَنتَصِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Instead	of	Allah?	Will	they	help	you	or	
retaliate?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allah	ke	siwā	kyā	woh		tumhāri	madad	kareiñ	
ge	yā	badlah	leñge	?

englishTranslationText: So	they	and	all	the	astray	were	flung	into	hell.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	auñdhā	diye	gaye	Jahannam	meiñ	woh		aur	
sab	gumrāh

englishTranslationText: And	all	the	armies	of	Iblis.	(Satan)
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Iblees	ke	lashkar	sāre

englishTranslationText:
And	they	will	say,	and	they	will	be	quarrelling	
in	it:
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kaheñ	ge	aur	woh	us	meiñ	bāham	Jhagadte	
hoñge

arabicText: تَٱللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِى ضَلَـٰلٍۢ مُّبِينٍ ٩٧
englishTranslationText:
“By	oath	of	Allah	,	we	were	indeed	in	open	
error.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Khudā	ki	qasam	be-shak	ham	khuli	gumrāhi	
meiñ	they

englishTranslationText:
“When	we	considered	you	equal	to	the	Lord	
Of	The	Creation.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jabke	tumheiñ	Rabbul	Āalameen	ke	barābar	
thahrāte		they

englishTranslationText: “And	none	misled	us	but	the	guilty.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Hameiñ	na	bahkāyā	magar	mujrimoñ	ne

englishTranslationText: “So	now	we	do	not	have	any	intercessors.”	(The	believers	shall	have	intercessors,	the	disbelievers	none).
romanUrduTranslationText: To	ab	Hamārā	koi	sifārishi	nahiñ

englishTranslationText: “Nor	a	caring	friend.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	na	koi	gamkhuwār	dost

arabicText: فَلَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةًۭ فَنَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText: So	if	only	were	we	to	go	back,	in	order	to	become	Muslims!”
romanUrduTranslationText: To	kisi	tarah	hameiñ	phir	jānā	hotā	ke	ham	Musalmān	hote

arabicText: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText: Indeed	in	this	is	a	sign;	and	most	of	them	were	not	believers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	is	meiñ	zaroor	nishāni	hai	aur	un	meiñ	bahut	Imān	wāle	na	they

englishTranslationText: And	indeed	your	Lord	-	only	He	is	the	Almighty,	the	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	tumhārā	Rab	wohi	izzat	wālā	maherbān	hai.

englishTranslationText: The	people	of	Nooh	denied	the	Noble	Messengers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Nūh	ki	Qaom	ne	Paighambaroñ	ko	jhutlāyā

arabicText: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText: When	their	fellowman	Nooh	said	to	them,	“Do	you	not	fear?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Jab	ke	unse	unke	ham	Qaom	Nūh	ne	kahā	kyā	tum	darte	nahiñ?

englishTranslationText: “I	am	indeed	a	trustworthy	Noble	Messenger	of	Allah	to	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	maiñ	tumhāre	liye	Allah	kā	bhejā	huwā	ameen	huñ

englishTranslationText: “Therefore	fear	Allah,	and	obey	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: To	Allah	se	daro	aur	merā	hukm	māno.

arabicText: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText: “And	I	do	not	ask	from	you	any	fee	for	it;	my	reward	is	only	upon	the	Lord	Of	The	Creation.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	maiñ	is	par	tumse	kuchh		ujrat	nahiñ	māñgtā	merā	ajr	to	usi	par	hai	jo	sāre	jahān	kā	Rab	hai.

englishTranslationText: “Therefore	fear	Allah,	and	obey	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: To	Allah	se	daro	aur	merā	hukm	māno	.

englishTranslationText: They	said,	“Shall	we	believe	in	you,	whereas	the	abject	people	are	with	you?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bole:	Kyā	ham	tumpar	Imān	le	āayeiñ	aur	tumhāre	sāth	kameene	huye	haiñ

arabicText: قَالَ وَمَا عِلْمِى بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“What	do	I	know	what	their	deeds	
are?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Farmāyā:	mujhe	kyā	khabar	unke	kām	kyā	
haiñ

arabicText: إِنْ حِسَابُهُمْ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّى ۖ لَوْ تَشْعُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Indeed	their	account	is	only	upon	my	
Lord,	if	you	perceive.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Unkā	hisāb	to	mere	Rab	hi	par	hai	agar	
tumheiñ	his	(Sha’oor)	ho

englishTranslationText: “And	I	will	not	repel	the	Muslims.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	maiñ	Musalmānoñ	ko	door	karne	wālā	
nahiñ

englishTranslationText: “I	am	not	but	clearly	a	Herald	of	Warning.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Maiñ	to	nahiñ	magar	sāf	dar	sunāne	wālā.

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَـٰنُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمَرْجُومِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“O	Nooh,	if	you	do	not	desist	you	
will	surely	be	stoned.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole:	Aey	Nūh	agar	tum	b’az	na	āye	to	
zaroor	sangsār	kiye	jāoge.

englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“My	Lord,	my	people	have	denied	
me.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Árz	ki	:	Aey		mere	Rab	meri	Qaom	ne	mujhe	
jhutlāyā.

arabicText: فَٱفْتَحْ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنَهُمْ فَتْحًۭا وَنَجِّنِى وَمَن مَّعِىَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Therefore	make	a	decisive	judgement	
between	me	and	them,	and	rescue	me	and	
the	believers	along	with	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tu	mujh	meiñ	aur	un	meiñ	poorā	faisla	
karde	aur	mujhe	aur	mere	sāth	wāle	
Musalmānoñ	ko	najāt	de.

arabicText: فَأَنجَيْنَـٰهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥ فِى ٱلْفُلْكِ ٱلْمَشْحُونِ
englishTranslationText:
So	We	saved	him	and	those	with	him	in	a	
laden	ship.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	hamne	bachā	liyā	usey	aur	uske	sāth	
wāloñ	ko	bhari	huyi		kashti	meiñ

englishTranslationText: Then	after	it,	We	drowned	the	rest.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	iske	b’ād	hamne	bāqiyoñ	ko	dubo	diyā

arabicText: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	in	this	is	a	sign;	and	most	of	them	
were	not	believers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	is	meiñ	zaroor	nishāni	hai	aur	un	
meiñ	aksar	Musalmān	na	they

englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	your	Lord,	only	He	is	the	
Almighty,	the	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	tumhārā	Rab	hi	izzat	wālā	
maherbān		hai	.

englishTranslationText:
(The	tribe	of)	A’ad	denied	the	Noble	
Messengers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Āad	ne	Rasooloñ	ko	jhutlāyā

arabicText: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
When	their	fellowman	Hud	said	to	them,	
“Do	you	not	fear?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jabke	unse	unke	ham	Qaum	Hood	ne	
farmāyā:	kyā	tum	darte	nahiñ

englishTranslationText:
“I	am	indeed	a	trustworthy	Noble	
Messenger	of	Allah	to	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	maiñ	tumhāre	liye	Allah	ka	
amānat	dār	Rasool	huñ

englishTranslationText: “Therefore	fear	Allah	and	obey	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: To	Allah	se	daro	aur	merā	hukm	māno

arabicText: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	maiñ	tumse	uspar	koi	ujrat	nahiñ	
māñgtā	merā	ajr	to	usi	par	hai	jo	sāre	jahān	
kā	Rab	hai.

englishTranslationText: “What!	You	build	a	structure	on	every	height,	to	laugh	at	the	passers-by?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	har	bulandi	par	ek	nishān	banāte	ho	
rāh	giroñ	se	hañsne	ko?

englishTranslationText: “And	prefer	strong	palaces,	that	perhaps	you	may	live	for	ever?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	mazboot	mahel	chunte	ho	is	ummeed	par	ke	tum	hamesha	rahoge

englishTranslationText: “And	when	you	apprehend	someone,	you	seize	him	mercilessly?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	kisi	par	girift	karte	ho	to	badi	be-dardi	se	girift	karte	ho

englishTranslationText: Therefore	fear	Allah,	and	obey	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: To	Allah	se	daro	aur	merā	hukm	māno

englishTranslationText: “Fear	Him	Who	has	aided	you	with	the	things	you	know.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	usse	daro	jisne	tumhāri	madad	ki	un	chizo	se	ke	tumheiñ	m’aloom	haiñ

englishTranslationText: “He	aided	you	with	cattle	and	sons.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Tumhāri	madad	ki	chaupāiyoñ	aur	betoñ

englishTranslationText: “And	with	gardens	and	water-springs.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	bāghoñ	aur	chashmoñ	se	.

arabicText: إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText: “Indeed	I	fear	upon	you	the	punishment	of	a	Great	Day.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	mujhe	tum	par	dar	hai	ek	bade	din	ke	áƶāb	kā

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيْنَآ أَوَعَظْتَ أَمْ لَمْ تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلْوَٰعِظِينَ
englishTranslationText: They	said,	“It	is	the	same	for	us,	whether	you	advise	us	or	not	be	of	the	preachers.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bole:	hameiñ	barābar	hai	chāhe	tum	naseehat	karo	yā	nāsihoñ	meiñ	na	ho

englishTranslationText:
“This	is	nothing	but	the	tradition	of	former	
people.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	to	nahiñ	magar	wohi	agloñ	ki	reet	
(Rasm-o-riwāj)

englishTranslationText: “And	we	will	not	be	punished.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	hameiñ	áƶāb	honā	nahiñ.

arabicText: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهْلَكْنَـٰهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
In	response	they	denied	him	-	We	therefore	
destroyed	them;	indeed	in	this	is	a	sign;	and	
most	of	them	were	not	believers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	unhoñ	ne	usey	jhutlāyā	to	hamne	
unheiñ	halāk	kiyā	be-shak	is	meiñ	zaroor	
nishāni	hai	aur	un	meiñ	bahut	Musalmān	
na	they

englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	your	Lord	-	only	He	is	the	
Almighty,	the	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	tumhārā	Rab	hi	izzat	wālā	
maherbān		hai

englishTranslationText:
The	Thamud	tribe	denied	the	Noble	
Messengers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Samood	ne	Rasooloñ	ko	jhutlāyā

arabicText: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ صَـٰلِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
When	their	fellowman	Saleh	said	to	them,	
“Do	you	not	fear?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jabke	un	se	unke	ham	Qaom	Sāleh	ne	
farmāyā:	kyā	darte	nahiñ?

englishTranslationText:
“I	am	indeed	a	trustworthy	Noble	
Messenger	of	Allah	to	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	maiñ	tumhāre	liye	Allah	kā	
amānat	dār	Rasool	huñ

englishTranslationText: “Therefore	fear	Allah	and	obey	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: To	Allah	se	daro	aur	merā	hukm	māno

arabicText: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	maiñ	tumse	kuch	is	par	ujrat	nahiñ	
māñgtā	merā	ajr	to	usi	par	hai	jo	sāre	jahān	
kā	Rab	hai

englishTranslationText:
“Will	you	be	left	peacefully	in	these	favours	
over	here?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kya	tum	yahāñ	ki	n’ematoñ	meiñ	chain	se	
chhod	diye	jāoge?

englishTranslationText: “In	gardens	and	water	springs?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bāghoñ	aur	chashmoñ

englishTranslationText:
“And	fields	and	palm-trees,	with	delicate	
tendrils?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	khetoñ	aur	khajooroñ	meiñ	jinka	
shagufā	narm	nāzuk

englishTranslationText:
“And	you	carve	out	dwellings	in	the	
mountains,	with	skill?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	pahādo	meiñ	se	ghar	tarāshte	ho	
ustādi	se

englishTranslationText: “Therefore	fear	Allah	and	obey	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: To	Allah	se	daro	aur	merā	hukm	māno.

englishTranslationText:
“And	do	not	follow	those	who	exceed	the	
limits.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	had	se	badhne	wāloñ	ke	kahne	par	na	
chalo

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ يُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ
englishTranslationText: “Those	who	spread	turmoil	in	the	earth,	and	do	no	reform.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	jo	zameen	meiñ	fasād	phailāte	haiñ	aur	banāo	nahiñ	karte

englishTranslationText: They	said,	“You	are	under	a	magic	spell.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bole:	tumpar	to	jādu	huā	hai.

arabicText: مَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌۭ مِّثْلُنَا فَأْتِ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText: You	are	just	a	human	like	us;	therefore	bring	some	sign	if	you	are	truthful.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	to	hamiñ	jaise	āadmi	ho	to	koi	nishāni	lāo	agar	sachche	ho.

arabicText: قَالَ هَـٰذِهِۦ نَاقَةٌۭ لَّهَا شِرْبٌۭ وَلَكُمْ شِرْبُ يَوْمٍۢ مَّعْلُومٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“This	is	the	she-camel	–	one	day	shall	be	her	turn	to	drink,	and	on	the	other	appointed	
day,	shall	be	your	turn.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Farmāyā:	yeh	naqa	hai	ek	din	iske	peene	ki	bāri	aur	ek	mu’ayyan	din	tumhāri	bāri

arabicText: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوٓءٍۢ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText: And	do	not	touch	her	with	evil	intentions	for	the	punishment	of	the	Great	Day	will	seize	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	isey	burāi	ke	sāth	na	chuo	ke	tumheiñ	bade	din	kā	áƶāb	ā	legā.

englishTranslationText: So	they	hamstrung	her,	and	in	the	morning	could	only	regret.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	isey	burāi	ke	sāth	na	chuo	ke	tumheiñ	bade	din	kā	áƶāb	ā	legā.

arabicText: فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
The	punishment	therefore	seized	them;	indeed	in	this	is	a	sign;	and	most	of	them	were	not	
believers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	unheiñ	áƶāb	ne	āa	liyā	be-shak	is	meiñ	zaroor	nishāni	hai	aur	aur	un	meiñ	bahut	Musalmān	
na	they

englishTranslationText: And	indeed	your	Lord	-	only	He	is	the	Almighty,	the	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	tumhārā	Rab	hi	Izzat	wālā	maherbān	hai

englishTranslationText:
The	people	of	Lut	denied	the	Noble	
Messengers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Lūt	ki	Qaum	ne	Rasooloñ	ko	jhutlāyā

arabicText: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
When	their	fellowman	Lut	said	to	them,	
“Do	you	not	fear?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jabke	un	meiñ	se	unke	ham	Qaom	Lūt	ne	
farmāyā:	kyā	tum	darte	nahiñ	?

englishTranslationText:
“I	am	indeed	a	trustworthy	Noble	
Messenger	of	Allah	to	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	maiñ	tumhāre	liye	Allah	kā	amānat	
dār	Rasool	huñ

englishTranslationText: “Therefore	fear	Allah	and	obey	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: To	Allah	se	daro	aur	merā	hukm	māno

arabicText: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	maiñ	ispar	tumse	kuch	ujrat	nahiñ	
māñgtā	merā	ajr	to	usi	par	hai	jo	sāre	jahān	
kā	Rab	hai

englishTranslationText:
“What!	Among	all	the	creatures,	you	
commit	the	immoral	acts	with	men?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	makhlooq	meiñ	mardoñ	se	bad-feli	
karte	ho?

arabicText: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُم مِّنْ أَزْوَٰجِكُم ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ عَادُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	leave	the	wives	your	Lord	has	
created	for	you?	In	fact	you	are	people	who	
exceed	the	limits.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	chordte	ho	woh		jo	tumhāre	liye	tumhāre	
Rab	ne	jorueñ	(Biwiyāñ)	banāyiñ	balke	tum	
log	had	se	badhne	wāle	ho

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَـٰلُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْرَجِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“O	Lut,	if	you	do	not	desist,	you	
will	be	expelled.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	:	Aey	Lūt	agar	tum	b’az	na	āye	to	zaroor	
nikāl	diye	jāoge

englishTranslationText: He	said,	“I	am	disgusted	with	your	works.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Farmāyā	:	maiñ	tumhāre	kām	se	bezār	huñ

englishTranslationText:
“My	Lord,	rescue	me	and	my	family	from	
their	deeds.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	mere	Rab	mujhe	aur	mere	ghar	wāloñ	ko	
inke	kām	se	bachā

englishTranslationText:
We	therefore	rescued	him	and	his	entire	
family.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	hamne	usey		aur	uske	sab	ghar	wāloñ	ko	
najāt	bakshi

englishTranslationText: Except	one	old	woman,	who	stayed	behind.
romanUrduTranslationText: Magar	ek	budhiyā,	ki	pichhe	rah	gayi

englishTranslationText: We	then	destroyed	the	others.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	Hamne	doosroñ	ko	halāk	kardiyā

arabicText: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًۭا ۖ فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	showered	a	rain	upon	them;	so	
what	a	wretched	rain	for	those	who	were	
warned!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Hamne	unpar	ek	barsāo	barsāyā	to	kyā	
hi	burā	barsāothā	darāye	gayoñ	kā

arabicText: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	in	this	is	a	sign;	and	most	of	them	
were	not	Muslims.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	is	meiñ	zaroor	nishāni	hai	aur	un	
meiñ	bahut	Musalmān	na	they

englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	your	Lord	-	only	He	is	the	
Almighty,	the	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	tumhārā	Rab	hi	izzat	wālā	
maherbān		hai

englishTranslationText: The	People	of	the	Woods	denied	the	Noble	Messengers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ban	(Jangal)	wāloñ	ne	Rasooloñ	ko	jhutlāyā

arabicText: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ شُعَيْبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText: When	Shuaib	said	to	all	of	them,	“Do	you	not	fear?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Jab	unse	Sho’aib	ne	farmāyā	kyā	darte	nahiñ?

englishTranslationText: “I	am	indeed	a	trustworthy	Noble	Messenger	of	Allah	to	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	maiñ	tumhāre	liye	Allah	kā	amānat	dār	Rasool	huñ

englishTranslationText: “Therefore	fear	Allah	and	obey	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: To	Allah	se	daro	aur	merā	hukm	māno

arabicText: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText: “And	I	do	not	ask	from	you	any	fee	for	it;	my	reward	is	only	upon	the	Lord	Of	The	Creation.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	maiñ	ispar	tumse	kuchh	ujrat	nahiñ	māngtā	merā	ajr	to	usi	par	hai	jo	sāre	jahān	kā	Rab	hai

arabicText: ۞ أَوْفُوا۟ ٱلْكَيْلَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْسِرِينَ
englishTranslationText: “Measure	in	full,	and	do	not	be	of	those	who	reduce.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Nāp	poorā	karo	aur	ghatāne	wāloñ	meiñ	na	ho

englishTranslationText: “And	weigh	with	a	proper	balance.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	sidhi	tarāzu	se	tolo

arabicText: وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا۟ ٱلنَّاسَ أَشْيَآءَهُمْ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
englishTranslationText: “And	do	not	give	the	people	their	goods	diminished,	and	do	not	roam	the	earth	causing	turmoil.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	logoñ	ki	cheezeñ	kam	karke	na	do	aur	zameen	meiñ	fasād	phailāte	na	phiro

englishTranslationText:
“And	fear	Him	Who	created	you	and	the	
earlier	creations.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	usse	daro	jisne	tumko	paidā	kiyā	aur	
agli	makhlooq	ko

englishTranslationText: They	said,	“You	are	under	a	magic	spell.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bole:	tumpar	jādu	huā	hai.

arabicText: وَمَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌۭ مِّثْلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلْكَـٰذِبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“You	are	just	a	human	like	us,	and	indeed	
we	consider	you	a	liar.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	to	nahiñ	magar	ham	jaise	ādmi	aur	
be-shak	ham	tumheiñ	jhootā	samjhte	haiñ

arabicText: فَأَسْقِطْ عَلَيْنَا كِسَفًۭا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Therefore	cause	a	part	of	the	sky	to	fall	
upon	us,	if	you	are	of	the	truthful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	ham	par	āsmān	kā	koi	tukdā	girā	do	
agar	tum	sachche	ho	?

englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“My	Lord	is	Well	Aware	of	what	
you	do.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Farmāyā	merā	Rab	khoob	jāntā	hai	jo	
tumhāre	koutak	(Kartoot)	haiñ

arabicText: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمِ ٱلظُّلَّةِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
englishTranslationText:
In	response	they	denied	him	–	therefore	
the	punishment	of	the	day	of	the	tent	*	
seized	them;	that	was	indeed	a	
punishment	of	a	Great	Day.	(The	clouds	
formed	a	tent	and	rained	fire	upon	them).
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	unhoñ	ne	usey	jhutlāyā	to	unheiñ	
shāmiyāne	wāle	din	ke	áƶāb		ne	āa	liyā		be
shak	woh	bade	din	kā	áƶāb	thā.

arabicText: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	in	this	is	a	sign;	and	most	of	them	
were	not	Muslims.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	is	meiñ	zaroor	nishāni	hai	aur	un	
meiñ	bahut	Musalmān	na	they

englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	your	Lord	-	only	He	is	the	
Almighty,	the	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	tumhārā	Rab	hi	izzat	wālā	
maherbān	hai

englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	this	Qur’an	has	been	sent	
down	by	the	Lord	Of	The	Creation.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	yeh	Qur’ān	Rabbul	āalameen	
kā	utārā	huā	hai.

englishTranslationText:
The	Trustworthy	Spirit	brought	it	down.	
(Angel	Jibreel	–	peace	be	upon	him.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Usey	Rooh-ul	Ameen	le	kar	utrā

englishTranslationText: Upon	your	heart,	for	you	to	convey	warning.
romanUrduTranslationText: Tumhāre	dil	par	ke	tum	dar	sunāo.

englishTranslationText: In	plain	Arabic	language.
romanUrduTranslationText: Raushan	Arabi	zabān	meiñ.

englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	it	is	mentioned	in	the	earlier	
Books.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	iskā	charchā	agli	kitāboñ	meiñ	
hai

arabicText: أَوَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُمْ ءَايَةً أَن يَعْلَمَهُۥ عُلَمَـٰٓؤُا۟ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
englishTranslationText:
And	was	this	not	a	sign	for	them,	that	the	
scholars	of	the	Descendants	of	Israel	may	
recognise	this	Prophet?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kyā	yeh	unke	liye	nishāni	na	thi	ke	us	
Nabi	ko	jānte	haiñ	bani	Isrā’il	ke	ālim

englishTranslationText: And	had	We	sent	it	down	upon	a	person	other	than	an	Arab,
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	ham	usey	kisi	ghair-Arabi	shakhs	
par	utārte

arabicText: فَقَرَأَهُۥ عَلَيْهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ مُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText: In	order	that	he	read	it	to	them,	even	then	they	would	not	have	believed	in	it
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	woh		unheiñ	padh	sunātā	jab	bhi	uspar	Imān	na	lāte

englishTranslationText: This	is	how	We	have	made	(the	habit	of)	denying	embedded	in	the	hearts	of	the	guilty.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ham	ne		yuñ	hi	jhutlānā	pairā	diyā	(Paiwast	kar	diya	)	hai	mujrimoñ	ke	diloñ	meiñ

arabicText: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلْأَلِيمَ
englishTranslationText: They	will	not	believe	in	it	to	the	extent	that	they	see	the	painful	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh		ispar	Imān	na	lāyeiñ	ge	yahāñ	tak	ke	dekheiñ	dard-nāk	áƶāb		.

englishTranslationText: So	it	will	come	upon	them	suddenly,	whilst	they	will	be	unaware.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	woh	achānak	unpar	āa	jayegā	aur	unheiñ	khabar	na	hogi

englishTranslationText: They	will	therefore	say,	“Will	we	get	some	respite?”
romanUrduTranslationText: To	kaheiñge	kyā	hameiñ	kuchh		mohlat	milegi?

englishTranslationText: So	do	they	wish	to	hasten	Our	punishment?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	kyā	hamāre	áƶāb	ki	jaldi	karte	haiñ	.

englishTranslationText: Therefore	observe,	that	if	We	give	them	some	comforts	for	some	years,	-
romanUrduTranslationText: Bhlā	dekho	to	agar	kuchh	baras	ham	unheñ	baratne	deiñ

englishTranslationText: And	then	the	promise	that	is	given	to	them,	does	come	upon	them-
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	āye	un	par	woh	jis	ka	woh	w’adā	diye	jāte	haiñ

arabicText: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يُمَتَّعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	of	what	benefit	will	be	the	comforts	that	
they	were	using?
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	kyā	kām	āyegā	unke	woh	jo	barat-te	
they
